channel.title: Comments on: VPN Client for Mac

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>Doh! I just checked the website for the comment at #1 - I think we got duped Matt ;o)</p>
item.content:encoded: Doh! I just checked the website for the comment at #1 – I think we got duped Matt ;o)

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@1 - Technically you're right, I could use the native Apple VPN client but once you sign a document stating you will use a certain bit of software then it's usually good practice to go along with your agreement!<br /><br />@2 - Now that's a good idea, never had a reason to play with AppleScript before. If only I had the spare time. Oh well another thing to add to the to do list.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
@1 – Technically you’re right, I could use the native Apple VPN client but once you sign a document stating you will use a certain bit of software then it’s usually good practice to go along with your agreement!

@2 – Now that’s a good idea, never had a reason to play with AppleScript before. If only I had the spare time. Oh well another thing to add to the to do list.

Matt

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>@1 why not? It's not like there's a standard for all this. At my company, we use a different suplier again, which is purely Windows-only, i.e. I'd never get in with my Mac, even if they wanted me to.<br /><br />@Matt: the situation you outline is a bit of a pain, I agree. Could this be a job for... Applescript??</p>
item.content:encoded:
@1 why not? It’s not like there’s a standard for all this. At my company, we use a different suplier again, which is purely Windows-only, i.e. I’d never get in with my Mac, even if they wanted me to.

@Matt: the situation you outline is a bit of a pain, I agree. Could this be a job for… Applescript??
